confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
Seven of the eight blocks in the 2,000â€‘unit complex were engulfed by the blaze.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the rapid spread of the fire.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level fire and are still conducting rescue operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.

timeline.event: Fire erupted at 2:50â€¯pm in Taiâ€¯Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex.
Firefighters responded; 13 deaths confirmed; 10 injuries reported.
BBC and Reuters report the incident; fire rated 5â€‘level.
